meanings.definition: A bag used for feeding animals.
meanings.sent1: The farmer filled the feedbags with hay for the hungry cows.
meanings.sent2: She carried the feedbags filled with seeds to the chicken coop.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to wear the feedbags as a hat!
meanings.sent4: The field was dotted with feedbags, like colorful balloons ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh hay from the feedbags lingered in the barn.

meanings.definition: A bag used for carrying food for consumption.
meanings.sent1: The hiker packed his feedbags with sandwiches and fruit for the trip.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed the feedbags filled with groceries from the car.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the feedbags were treasure chests full of goodies.
meanings.sent4: Her feedbags were like a portable pantry, always ready for a snack.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of warm bread wafted from the feedbags she carried.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for a person who eats excessively.
meanings.sent1: He teased his friend, calling him a feedbags for finishing the whole pizza.
meanings.sent2: The comedian joked about being a feedbags at the all-you-can-eat buffet.
meanings.sent3: She playfully called her brother a feedbags when he asked for seconds.
meanings.sent4: The feedbags at the party seemed to have hollow legs, eating everything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The image of a human feedbags devouring a mountain of food was both amusing and alarming.
